data.description: A native Arbitrum-centric money market.It aims to provide first-class infrastructure to native Arbitrum assets such as MAGIC and GMX, as well as blue-chip assets in the Ethereum ecosystem. The project has found a niche by facilitating money markets for yield-bearing assets, including those native to Arbitrum like plvGLP and wstETH.
data.title: Lodestar Finance

data.description:
Lodestar is a Typescript ecosystem for Ethereum consensus, developed by ChainSafe Systems. Our flagship products are our production-capable beacon chain and validator client. In addition, we maintain public repositories of useful tools for public use. Some of these libraries include BLS, SSZ, Discv5, Gossipsub, and Noise.

Work was completed to support the Ethereum ecosystem by most recently enabling EIP-4844 blobs to benefit L2s, reducing tx costs of L2 fees and increasing client diversity at the L1 protocol level. 

Lodestar’s niche is in its implementation language, TypeScript. Our software and tooling is uniquely situated as the go-to for researchers and developers for rapid prototyping such as our Prover, a verified web3 provider using light clients to increase decentralization and security of the JSON-RPC. Millions of developers around the world are familiar with Typescript, and Lodestar’s high-quality codebases are excellent introductions to the Ethereum world. With the goal of increasing client diversity and attracting new talent from one of the largest groups of developers in the world.

We fully support other teams in Protocol and projects which indirectly fund client team implementors such as Protocol Guild.
data.title: Lodestar
Short Term Incentive Program
data.description:
**Grant Objective**

To incentivize depositing and borrowing activity in the Lodestar Markets and participation in their emission gauge.

**Grant Size Justification**

Project growth and scale achieved independently of the ArbitrumDAO airdrop. Their position at the higher end of the Siren Grants category, coupled with a substantial TVL without prior grant support, underscores their potential for further enhancing the Arbitrum ecosystem.

Please find more details here: https://forum.arbitrum.foundation/t/lodestar-finance-final-stip-round-1/16981

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.
How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.
questions.explanation: Lodestar is currently 1-2.6% of the mainnet validators according to clientdiversity.org and account for 2.9% of the beacon nodes visible on the discv5 distributed hash table according to ProbeLab's discv5 weekly report 2024-42. By providing a TypeScript implementation to Ethereum consensus, we ensure the safety and redundancy of the liveness of the Ethereum blockchain as an alternative minority client. We open up the possibilities for developing and engaging with the largest developer base in the world to contribute to the Ethereum protocol. Additionally, our contributions to other dependencies of the JavaScript/TypeScript ecosystem such as js-libp2p and EthereumJS, help ensure that many builders benefit from JS/TS tooling when building their infrastructure and applications.

questions.query: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.
questions.explanation: We've recently improved performance metrics in our client by leveraging napi-rs bindings within our implementation. By enhancing performance of the Lodestar consensus client, we provide a better user experience for those looking to stake, develop or run nodes on Ethereum. We are one of six consensus clients continually working on interoperability between client implementations by helping to maintain the standardized beacon-APIs that are used within Ethereum clients.

questions.query: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?
questions.explanation: Lodestar is one of the largest consumers and contributors to JavaScript/TypeScript ecosystem libraries that are essential to the success of not just Ethereum, but the wider use of technologies such as libp2p, discv5, SSZ, KZG/BLS crypto. We ensure that developers have access to the tooling we create/leverage to create the applications you see on top of Ethereum's stack. Without our continual maintenance and addition to supporting new standards for the JS/TS ecosystem, many potential users may find alternatives. For example, with the deprecation of the mplex , we've developed libraries for yamux and quic replacements. We also continue to help contribute to R&D with the latest implementations in the Electra hard fork and continue to find new bugs within the specification protocol for the improvement of Ethereum.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation: Our project is completely funded by open source, public goods funding. Gitcoin adds to our ability to continue working on this project by paying for project expenses that would otherwise hamper our ability to hire more contributors, pay for testing infrastructure, host public node endpoints (checkpoint sync, light client APIs, etc.) and supporting our engagements at events such as Devcon and other conferences.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?
questions.explanation: We are one of the minority clients used on Ethereum Layer 1, adding redundancy and diversification to the network as the only TypeScript implementation of Ethereum consensus. Our existence allows Ethereum to continue moving forward on R&D developments and pushing the envelope on decentralizing the Ethereum L1 stack and creates additional bandwidth for things like the security of the network.

questions.query: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.
How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.
questions.explanation: Lodestar continues to contribute to the Ethereum TypeScript ecosystem through its beacon chain and validator client implementations of Ethereum consensus. We continue contributing to libraries which help elevate the Ethereum JS ecosystem such as js-libp2p, discv5 and SSZ.

questions.query: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.
questions.explanation: Lodestar is known to be very user friendly, especially now that we offer AMD64 and ARM64 binaries for use. We are an option on many node operator software such as eth-docker and Rocketpool Smart Node, so it's easy for you to pick a client such as ours with minimal overhead. We now offer SSZ support on nearly all of our endpoints to better serve users faster and with less latency when interacting with our beacon node.

questions.query: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?
questions.explanation: We are a minority client which continues to push the boundaries on experimental implementations alongside maintaining a mainnet, production ready beacon node. We are researching, contributing and implementing new features that Ethereum will hopefully adopt such as FOCIL, EIP-4788 and future network stack upgrades such as js-libp2p-quic. In addition, we aim to be a client that offers performance and an alternative to the current major client implementations to minimize disastrous results such as the Holesky testnet rescue, where we helped to quickly integrate new features to rescue the chain from non-finality. These features include unfinalized checkpoint state imports which allow your beacon node to ingest unfinalized checkpoints to handle chains of long non-finality.

questions.query: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.
questions.explanation: The funds will be used to continue development of Lodestar and contribute to the Ethereum protocol community. ChainSafe generally contracts external freelancers to contribute to the code base and help propel Ethereum forward. The work requires generous donations that come from the community to help support a minority client to contribute to Ethereum R&D. This may also include other support roles and systems such as testing/checkpoint infrastructure and public endpoints for developers.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?
questions.explanation: Our project ensures there is another viable alternative to the current consensus clients. We are the only TypeScript based consensus client which performs just as great as other clients running with systems level languages. By supporting a minority client, you help ensure there are other choices to help maintain and ensure stability on the Ethereum network.
